technology.short_description: There is always value in a lightning strike to harvest useful items, whatever they may be.
A Warlord’s rule will only ever be as effective as his enforcers allow it to be.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing friendly expendable units rout does not reduce other units' leadership, unless they are themselves expendable.

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the Skaven's vicious, uncompromising agenda to another level altogether.

effects.description: Adds an extra Clanrat unit to the army spawned from "The Vermintide" Under-City building

technology.short_description: Born from the fusion of Skaven with a range of horrific creatures, Rat Ogres are bereft of reason and almost devoid of sanity.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Rat Ogres and Mutant Rat Ogre units
Charge bonus: +10 for Rat Ogres and Mutant Rat Ogre units

technology.short_description: A misshapen mountain of flesh and muscle, with mechanical parts grafted on. Very nasty.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Hell Pit Abomination units
Weapon strength: +10% for Hell Pit Abomination units

technology.short_description: A host of holy horrors to direct our aimless dance.

effects.description: Adds a Hell Pit Abomination unit to the army spawned from "The Vermintide" Under-City building
Recruit rank: +2 for Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre and Hell Pit Abomination units
Speed: +10% for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror and Hell Pit Abomination units

technology.short_description: The Rites of Infection will be spoken, and the true plague-blessed will be unleashed upon the world.

effects.description: Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from Nurgle Plagues and Corruption
Enable recruitment: Anointed Plague Monks units

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the Skaven's vicious, uncompromising agenda to another level altogether.
Lack of food can be a great motivator.
Large numbers of ill-trained, ill-equipped warriors can still perform a useful function.
Yes-yes, take all of it! Yes, all - we can split-divide the spoils later- trust me, yes-yes!

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +5%

technology.short_description: We are the Children of the Horned Rat, survivors all and as we were here before you, so shall we be present to see you fall.

effects.description: Leadership: +10 when laying siege or encircling

technology.short_description: "Treat ‘em mean, keep ‘em keen!"
Devouring their way to domination over their lesser littermates, the freaks of the brood are always a Packmaster’s preferred choice.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Wolf Rat and Brood Horror units
Bonus vs Infantry: +4 for Wolf Rat and Brood Horror units

technology.short_description: The more the clan knows about breeding the nastiest traits into the most vicious rat-beasts, the better!

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Wolf Rat and Brood Horror units
Upkeep: -5% for Wolf Rats and Brood Horror units

technology.short_description: Those who display a willingness to betray their own, and just the right amount of vicious savagery, find themselves progressing within the Skaven hierarchy.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Warlock Engineers
Ammunition: +20% for Doomwheels, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Doomwheels, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units

technology.short_description: Bad workmen are the same the world over…

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Plagueclaw Catapult, Doom-Flayers, Warp Lightning Cannon and Doomwheel units
Weapon strength: +10% for Doomwheel and Doom-Flayers units
Missile strength: +10% for Plague Claw Catapults, Warp Lightning Cannons and Doomwheel units

technology.short_description: Plague Monks are stronger-better than rats of other, lesser clans.

effects.description: Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition

technology.short_description: They toil incessantly, the ringing a constant cacophony that can only be ignored with the greatest of efforts. Are they... getting louder?
Bring forth the agents of infection and blessed corruption.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 20% for Plague Monks and Plague Claw Catapult units

technology.short_description: Casualties mean little when your population literally breed like rats.
The tide of monstrous rats flowed over them one by one, dragging them down to be torn apart…
Research the following items to advance the Skaven's vicious, uncompromising agenda to another level altogether.

effects.description: Adds an extra Clanrat unit to the army spawned from "The Vermintide" Under-City building

technology.short_description: It's always best to test a new concoction before unleashing it on the enemy.

effects.description: Range: +10% for Warpfire Thrower, Ratling Gun, Warplock Jezzails, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units
Missile strength: +10% for Warpfire Thrower, Ratling Gun, Warplock Jezzails, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the Skaven's vicious, uncompromising agenda to another level altogether.

effects.description: Adds an extra Clanrat unit to the army spawned from "The Vermintide" Under-City building

technology.short_description: Masks and armoured suits are useful, not just for protecting Skaven from the enemy, but also from their own crazy contraptions...

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Warpfire Thrower, Ratling Gun, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units

technology.short_description: Mundane wounds such as lost limbs or rotted organs bring blessed comfort to the warriors of Clan Pestilens.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: Incising the backs of the writhing Plague Monks with their blades, the lords and agents of Pestilens carry with them the most malignant of weapons.
We follow in the pawsteps of the Great Horned Rat!

effects.description: Weapon strength: +20% for Plague Monks units
Reload time reduction: +20% for Plague Claw Catapult units

technology.short_description: Woe betide any who raise their voices to decry, or even question, the decisions of their betters.
A wise warlord stockpiles ammunition long before it is needed.

effects.description: Adds an extra Plagueclaw Catapult unit to the army spawned from "The Vermintide" Under-City building
Ammunition: +25% for Infantry, Warpfire Thrower, Ratling Gun, Warplock Jezzails, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units

technology.short_description: It’s hard to imagine, but there are some among this most venal, treacherous race who don't quite make the grade or indeed live much longer…

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Warpfire Thrower, Ratling Gun, Warplock Jezzails, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Warpfire Thrower, Warplock Jezzails, Ratling Gun, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units

technology.onscreen_name: Secrets of the Book of Woe
technology.short_description: Within the Liber Bubonicus lies knowledge-secrets known only to Skrolk and Nurglitch.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -25% for Lore of Plague spells

technology.short_description: To fail an assassination attempt against an agent of Clan Pestilens is to die a painful, horrible death.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

technology.short_description: The Horned Rat provides.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 10% for Plague Monks and Plague Claw Catapult units

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the Skaven's vicious, uncompromising agenda to another level altogether.
It means nothing if Skavenslaves die meeting a quota, there will always be more - many more - where they came from.
If you want something done right, it's best to publicly kill the one who did it wrong so the others learn.
Their vast network of underground tunnels enable the Skaven to move around the world largely undetected.
All the screams, the contortions, the howls of agony don't mean much unless the end result is useable and, more importantly, repeatable.

effects.description: Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Plague Priests

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the Skaven's vicious, uncompromising agenda to its ultimate conclusion.

effects.description: Adds an extra Clanrat unit to the army spawned from "The Vermintide" Under-City building

technology.short_description: Selective breeding and genetic manipulation will breed the strongest Skaven yet.

effects.description: Replaces all Clanrat units spawned from "The Vermintide" Under-City building with Stormvermin

technology.short_description: Bring the best, most devoted Plague Monks to Skrolk!

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +10 for Plague Priests

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: Weeping wounds pour pus and blood over the scabs and dried lesions of the faithful. Pain has no hold over the Plague Monks.
Come brothers, I carry the plague scriptures; soon, the whole world will succumb to the Great Plague of Pestilens!

effects.description: Enable Plague (damage over time) contact effect for Plague Claw Catapult units (Contaminated still applies on explosion)

technology.short_description: Needless to say, any Clanrats with ideas above their stations are quickly, and permanently, silenced.
To make the foe see, hear and smell something else entirely, and then exploit their confusion - that's war taken to the next level.

effects.description: Melee attack: +8 for Plague Monks units

technology.short_description: It's easier to influence matters when many above ground don't believe you exist...
Skaven covet Warpstone above all else; the ability to mutate weeds out the weak and strengthens those who are already strong.
Unlike other clans who would eat such deformed offspring and kill their brood-mother, Clan Pestilens embraces the mutations.
Good-good, spread the blessings-graces of the Great Horned Rat to all.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +25% for armies
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

technology.short_description: No longer able to contain their excitement, the faithful charge into battle with delightful abandon.

effects.description: Speed: +25% for Plague Monks and Plague Claw Catapult units

technology.short_description: We-us get in there and kill-slay until they're mostly all dead, then we get out again - let second wave mop up, yes-yes!
There is nowhere to hide, nowhere safe to conspire, that isn't watched by agents of the Council.
Research the following items to advance the Skaven's vicious, uncompromising agenda to another level altogether.

effects.description: Adds an extra Clanrat unit to the army spawned from "The Vermintide" Under-City building

technology.short_description: A little more nightshade, a little less mandrake… good-perfect, Lizard-things won't stand a chance, yes-yes!

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Plague Monks units
Speed: +10% for Plague Monks and Plague Claw Catapult units

technology.short_description: No corruption too great, no disease too foul; if the Skaven want territory above-ground they will stop at nothing to acquire it.

effects.description: Adds an extra Plague Monk unit to the army spawned from "The Vermintide" Under-City building
Physical resistance: 5% for Plague Monks and Plague Claw Catapult units

technology.short_description: The small number who survive the vigorous selection process are well equipped and given a share of the spoils to ensure their future loyalty.

effects.description: Adds a Doomwheel unit to the army spawned from "The Vermintide" Under-City building
Recruit rank: +2 for Stormvermin and Death Runners units

technology.short_description: The fetid air and toxic ground surrounding Pestilens' armies not only torments their foes, but protects and nourishes their faithful warriors.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero
Unit is not Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: The plans of the Arch-Plaguelord brought to fruition!
Limbs, tails, even heads severed, and still they keep coming! What foul magics could beget such atrocities?

effects.description: Passive ability: "Plague of Undeath" for Plague Monks and Plague Claw Catapult units

attributes.bullet_text: Entities in this unit take damage, but cannot die.

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the Skaven's vicious, uncompromising agenda to another level altogether.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Skavenslaves units

technology.short_description: Whereby war's notional rulebook is tossed away in favour of unbridled, fiendish savagery.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
Missile strength: +10% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units

technology.short_description: What to do when the agent you require works for another clan, who clearly do not appreciate his talents?

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -10% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
Ammunition: +10% to Gutter Runners and Night Runners units

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the Skaven's vicious, uncompromising agenda to another level altogether.

effects.description: Adds an extra Clanrat unit to the army spawned from "The Vermintide" Under-City building

technology.short_description: Fear of being dragged away and killed is another great motivator.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Death Runners units
Charge bonus: +10 for Death Runners units

technology.short_description: Unsurprisingly, even more shouting, combined with terrible punishments, does tend to yield the desired results.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units

technology.short_description: The advanced skills Skaven assassins learn in the Far East appear quite alien, but are no less effective when practised at home.
It's difficult to imagine the Skaven concept of malfeasance, but it must exist; ‘criminals’ are put to work, as an alternative to an agonising death.
There is always high demand for assassins willing to murder for someone who needs to keep their own hands clean.

effects.description:
Assassinate action: Additional 10% success chance
	(all heroes factionwide)

technology.short_description: If you wish to survive the turbulent, cutthroat world of Skaven politics you need loyal warriors on your side.
The Plague-bearers carry with them the ultimate pox, spreading blessed filth across the world.

effects.description: Control: -2 in enemy provinces where an army is present
Recruitment cost: -25% for Plague Monks and Plagueclaw Catapult units
